resources.string: The Sun will not go above %1$.1f° in the foreseeable future, setting %2$.1f° will always yield the same non-results.
The Sun will not go below %1$.1f° in the foreseeable future, setting %2$.1f° will always yield the same non-results.
The widget will show the current angle and the time range when the Sun is above %1$.0f°.
The widget will show the current angle and the time range when the Sun is below %1$.0f°.

What's that degree (°)? 
Altitude angle. The widget shows the current position of the Sun, which is the angle between the horizon and the Sun: 
￼


Threshold 
You can set a threshold for the Sun's position. The threshold will show the time range when the Sun's altitude angle is above/below the threshold. The time range will be bold when the Sun is in the right position. The start/end time of the range will be highlighted up to 30 minutes before the Sun enters/leaves the specified range. 
For example: if the threshold is above 0° this is good for a soft alert before sunrise/sunset.


Hide parts of the widget 
Open the options menu to do so. You can show/hide the part of the day and last update time displays in case your phone's current launcher doesn't give enough space for the widget.
